0BE5E6CAB0F5488FB55426914FBCD1C5.description: Evaluate group process:  evaluate the quality of own contributions to group process, and offer constructive feedback to others; propose suggestions for improvement

A8DE9CEA74F24A9A991DFD6F3531B199.description: organize and complete tasks cooperatively by defining roles and responsibilities, negotiating to find the basis for agreement, setting objectives and time frames, and reviewing progress

ECC1B585E12044BF91FFA59E3DE2FB65.description: contribute ideas, knowledge and strategies to identify group information needs and sources

E5B6C2D5CB2D4D1798F1D94BF30C31AE.description: use opportunities as a group member to contribute to group goals and extend own learning

F2EB721FC7344F7491BB1434FF378B32.description: propose ideas or advocate points of view that recognize the ideas of others and advance the thinking of the group

B4ECF73E8FBC472D8AD4D177DA39F118.description: Use language to show respect:  use inclusive language and actions that demonstrate respect for people of different races, cultures, genders, ages and abilities

DADDB42801A04F5C85469AAFCFC363A1.description: Celebrate accomplishments and events:  participate in organizing and celebrating special events, recognizing the appropriateness and significance of language arts

DEC0EA4ACF05428DBF241039A0750796.description: Relate texts to culture:  compare ways in which oral, print and other media texts reflect specific elements of cultures or periods in history

2630A8206C9B4FB9B10849424A9D2C83.description:
Appreciate diversity:  compare own with others' understanding of people, cultural traditions and values portrayed in oral, print and other media texts
clarify and broaden perspectives and opinions, by examining the ideas of others

D439601837CF4224BCDA47F5BC4C4853.description: use appropriate verbal and nonverbal feedback to respond respectfully

05E8550AA88442188545822D05F243B7.description: anticipate the organizational pattern of presentations, and identify important ideas and supporting details

76A956B6FFBA4E01A343EF7C30C08176.description: Use effective oral and visual communication:  plan and shape presentations to achieve particular purposes or effects, and use feedback from rehearsals to make modifications

C046C82D003E4B979A9B062D095E7DE3.description: Enhance presentation:  present information to achieve a particular purpose and to appeal to interest and background knowledge of reader or audience

F174EFFE871D4B9699ACE758B6AECF77.description: Present information:  plan and facilitate small group and short, whole class presentations to share information

9BF2703A6E0F4DD594F57EBD24A63675.description: use appropriate capitalization and punctuation for referencing oral, print and other media texts

077CC9D792724D50A925A83F8C73B042.description: use parentheses appropriately in own writing

790AA75928EC4F89AEED883834FC9BCE.description: identify semicolons, dashes and hyphens when reading, and use them to assist comprehension

02A68AA2377E4A9B82724333DB494363.description: use hyphens to break words at the end of lines, and to make a new word from two related words in own writing

6747E95D395E495FB4047768543D4F3A.description: identify the use of spelling variants in print and other media texts, and discuss the effectiveness depending on audience and purpose

A854CDD3BDE94ECF9D51B17280C99FD0.description: use knowledge of spelling generalizations and how words are formed to spell technical terms and unfamiliar words in own writing

D458C80746DA4744953987C6A19D21E5.description: develop a systematic and effective approach to studying and remembering the correct spelling of key words encountered in a variety of print and other media texts

A2FE07DA7D0A4E86BFA98BB9D93C1F09.description: use verb tenses consistently throughout a piece of writing

47987CE118B043DE8E2521A4FA0BEEAE.description: correct pronoun-antecedent agreement in own writing

ED09F85EAE754C8EA206DEA01F808D9C.description: use a variety of simple, compound and complex sentence structures to communicate effectively, and to make writing interesting use

BF877C0AEC5E49318C12C1AC9696A568.description: use words and phrases to modify, clarify and enhance ideas and descriptions in own writing

EB234895014F4C03B0C1DAADD2440BA2.description: Enhance artistry:  experiment with figurative language, voice, sentence patterns, camera angle and music to create an impression or mood

0E9B14C0BAA34E7785DEF423E7F86E3E.description: infer the literal and figurative meaning of words in context, using idioms, analogies, metaphors and similes

D3D568FFCEF64B86AF140E5AA7334C4F.description: explore and explain ways that new words, phrases and manners of expression enter the language as a result of factors, such as popular culture, technology, other languages

6B00582460C3425CBFDAB8494CA0C498.description: choose an effective format for documents, depending on the content, audience and purpose

AE51278B74FA4F7EAAA60E724955B2D4.description: vary handwriting style and pace, depending on the context, audience and purpose

91966EC66A34416588113C7C8C4B376E.description: use paragraph structures to demonstrate unity and coherence

A627965F945C4ED99FA4D1D5DDDA3849.description: enhance the coherence and impact of documents, using electronic editing functions

8CD1F228CDF1476F8FC5AAFD1E143FC1.description: revise to enhance sentence variety, word choice and appropriate tone

98036C1841C5472F84A89F753A073337.description: revise by adding words and phrases that emphasize important ideas or create dominant impressions

F23619049DA14C29A891E61DA732A760.description: evaluate how particular content features contribute to, or detract from, the overall effectiveness of own and others' oral, print and other media texts; make and suggest revisions

B26607CB637C4067AE27C6A64D2A99BA.description: share draft oral, print and other media texts in a way that will elicit useful feedback

F633FF1F927344008F294F4252A4A463.description: Review research process:  assess the research process, and consider alternative ways of achieving research goals

66CD53922FB141D7BCA0F433A3D7191F.description: integrate appropriate visual, print and/or other media to inform and engage the audience

6AF3C93A95084841885AD720ABE7BF22.description: communicate ideas and information in a variety of oral, print and other media texts, such as interviews, minilessons and documentaries

BF320B5B3B324B338005095092588819.description: incorporate new information with prior knowledge and experiences to develop new understanding

05DCBEFFDCE145B487953C4D77913ACD.description: evaluate the relevance and importance of gathered information; address information gaps

E55A4978618347BF8D214E836E717A81.description: use a consistent and approved format to give credit for quoted and paraphrased ideas and information

4EC0ED0FA85849F2A93B93803C711324.description: discard information that is irrelevant for audience, purpose, form or point of view

E7DF0C7463A745D6A660536EBB3726F7.description: make notes in point form, summarizing major ideas and supporting details; reference sources

88C8A3620B2C4E15AB21B5F435739F60.description: organize ideas and information to establish an overall impression or point of view in oral, print and other media texts

C68EBC40994645F39249035ED7CFEB8E.description: organize ideas and information creatively, as well as logically, to develop a comparison or chronology, or to show a cause-effect relationship

02C725AA7D4E40FAB9A8F6A610D256BE.description: Evaluate sources:  develop and use criteria for evaluating the usefulness, currency and reliability of information for a particular research project

23E3F53F39574ECC8BFDDD8C5E02B590.description: adjust rate of reading or viewing to suit purpose and density of information in print or other media texts

70D93D3A868148A68D2B62F7E716F2A8.description: record key ideas and information from oral, print and other media texts, avoiding overuse of direct quotations

E3C8281A4236487E87F45AF039560EEA.description: expand and use a variety of tools and text features, such as subtitles, margin notes, key words, electronic searches, previews, reviews, visual effects and sound effects, to access information

7E04D7E7A14B433C9A4BCD5367D9D3EA.description: Use a variety of sources:  obtain information from a variety of sources, such as artifacts, debates, forums, biographies, autobiographies, surveys, documentaries, films, CDROMs, charts and tables, when conducting research

358F553EF22043EDBE5A1C371C012F7E.description: Plan to gather information:  choose a plan to access, gather and record information, according to self-selected parameters

97AD6FEB0A0447FC9B8AEEF90347A59D.description: Determine information needs:  select the most appropriate information sources for topic, audience, purpose and form

3141BE91814941DE83D1E2E207D26B0B.description: identify and trace the development of arguments, opinions or points of view in oral, print and other media texts

F13CD355E9424172AD3DCE3654471F01.description: experiment with several ways to focus a topic, and select a form appropriate to audience and purpose

2B3AD33800A9470A9BCACBA8CA9D8784.description: choose forms or genres of oral, print or other media texts for the particular affects they will have on audiences and purposes

8A09D444FDC14804AB227E23C966D544.description: create oral, print and other media texts with both main and minor characters

EC0E0FED24A74C3B9D10DF5F66E44EB5.description: Elaborate on the expression of ideas:  retell oral, print and other media texts from different points of view

5AEE57A9024D4C7B900C07B7B5B62AB6.description: Generate ideas:  create oral, print and other media texts related to issues encountered in texts and in own life

739004D2F97640E8871DEC9924C6D8AE.description: Experiment with language:  identify creative uses of language and visuals in popular culture, such as commercials, rock videos and magazines; explain how imagery and figurative language, such as hyperbole, create tone and mood

EB07D63C617F4E489E1316D09FB69A90.description: summarize the content of media texts, and discuss the choices made in planning and producing them

C85E3F69E3FF4669B42FC2EE6C33FC5F.description: compare and contrast the different perspectives provided by first and third person narration

CFB1630C896344F0A29D56C0224ACD76.description: identify and explain characters' qualities and motivations, by considering their words and actions, their interactions with other characters and the author's or narrator's perspective

9E2BEBDCDE554A94B0A5DDAFD4AB0D3F.description: distinguish theme from topic or main idea in oral, print and other media texts

3275F3578ED148FA8C981E9F52E43CE1.description: compare the usefulness of different types of media texts

A4F84D69BB1F4A50BACB47B73E1A2539.description: discuss how the choice of form or genre of oral, print and other media texts is appropriate to purpose and audience

770481FFAA1740FFA2860DEDB28358AA.description: identify and discuss how word choice and order, figurative language, plot, setting and character work together to create mood and tone

001AB56E8D0748D4982F4A5683F4A331.description: identify ways that characters can be developed, and discuss how character, plot and setting are interconnected and mutually supportive

BE2A6C22CDDA400FA5CA0A0C0877385B.description: discuss how techniques, such as word choice, balance, camera angles, line and framing, communicate meaning and enhance effects in oral, print and other media texts

DC3CCE7B06154B76A24C90EC206B47CD.description: compare two similar oral, print or other media texts by considering the characters, plot, conflicts and main ideas

DDB8950935424084BED77992F5C91FFE.description: discuss various ways characters are developed and the reasons for and plausibility of character change

A232592D1F6947E98D1C461C73E7018B.description: identify and describe characters' attributes and motivations, using evidence from the text and personal experiences

6B49D2A223BC4C2FACD1F0967333155A.description: interpret the choices and motives of characters portrayed in oral, print and other media texts, and examine how they relate to self and others

2A19D2D0DDB94E7EAC1CF9B348E2CAA9.description: make connections between biographical information about authors, illustrators, storytellers and filmmakers and their texts

2E0733599F5C442FB852BBEAD1713AAE.description: explain connections between own interpretation and information in texts, and infer how texts will influence others

E1D55E84C6FF40C9A2E659170C87D4ED.description: expect that there is more than one interpretation for oral, print and other media texts, and discuss other points of view

5F7EB76BF0E746CF8F9B9E4875102B73.description: write and represent narratives from other points of view

4425F60A31144BCA8F03E61F2EBD7BF1.description: experience oral, print and other media texts from a variety of cultural traditions and genres, such as magazine articles, diaries, drama, poetry, Internet passages, fantasy, nonfiction, advertisements and photographs

4CB29414345A43E2A95893AB80386F76.description: Use references:  use a thesaurus to extend vocabulary and locate appropriate words that express particular aspects of meaning

61FA78411CBE4B2C888D1DBA5FF80E1C.description: Use phonics and structural analysis:  choose and use strategies for word identification, vocabulary development and spelling that either build on specific strengths or address areas for improvement

D358ED09435D4EC59C9405EDD2B87842.description: identify and use structural features of a variety of oral, print and other media texts, such as newspapers, magazines, instruction booklets, advertisements and schedules, encountered in everyday life to access ideas and information and to read with purpose

4E2965B19AB84D7FB85823A6A4844405.description: identify and use visual and textual cues in reference materials, such as catalogues, databases, web sites, thesauri and writers' handbooks, to access information effectively and efficiently

34CB47EC51EC49A7B440287463BA895F.description: take notes, make outlines and use such strategies as read, recite, review to comprehend and remember ideas and information

2D32710B1DC5482D9F77920BA6008FB6.description: monitor understanding; skim, scan or read slowly and carefully, as appropriate, to enhance comprehension

95219748981E432DB3FD3BC1727B6F60.description: enhance understanding by paraphrasing main ideas and supporting details, and by rereading and discussing relevant passages

B828D561F7064C3AB50DDEE3BC0A172C.description: use knowledge of authors, forms and genres, developed during previous reading, to direct and extend reading experiences

F4AFF0271B984C7695ADD11156BE57B0.description: use strategies to supplement and extend prior knowledge and experiences when interpreting new ideas and information

98FBDEB3CEA241F3A32822BDDE496057.description: Extend understanding:  reconsider and revise initial understandings and responses in light of new ideas, information and feedback from others

7FC2382CF5234C50B1A9A23C9D64928A.description: Combine ideas:  exchange ideas and opinions to clarify understanding and to broaden personal perspectives

2F5ABB15E4B442D5ABE9E7636BCF897B.description: Consider the ideas of others:  acknowledge the value of the ideas and opinions of others in exploring and extending personal interpretations and perspectives

8E88B14088884D4CAD6AA87CE8025397.description: Set goals:  examine and reflect on own growth in effective use of language to revise and extend personal goals

DBB2005562B24C08A7C7DC96F49D58A2.description: Express preferences:  pursue personal interest in specific genres by particular writers, artists, storytellers and filmmakers

C9BA7170E4E04024AE6676687D323DD3.description: Experiment with language and forms: discuss and respond to ways that forms of oral, print and other media texts enhance or constrain the development and communication of ideas, information and experiences

B26E143E4283453B92298362F8278156.description: seek out and consider diverse ideas, opinions and experiences to develop and extend own ideas, opinions and experiences

F34A2F30207F4278896033599B0E2429.description: review, reread, discuss and reflect on oral, print and other media texts to explore, confirm or revise understanding

523221A0862B47ABABE666D00155423C.description: revise understanding and expression of ideas by connecting new and prior knowledge and experiences
